name: hazily
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is not clearly remembered or noticed: She only hazily remembered her previous visit. He was hazily aware of a dull ache in the small of his back.
in a way that cannot be seen very clearly, especially because of heat: The sun rose hazily behind the palm trees. The streets and monuments of Athens stretched hazily away to the mountains.
More examplesFewer examplesWhat was happening to her, she wondered hazily.He walked along the hazily familiar terrain.Brownish clouds drifted hazily over the landscape.Meg saw him hazily through the steam from the pan.
